intro: Mycaranthes stricta, commonly known as the rigid thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often covered in fine hairs. Mycaranthes stricta is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
